activities.loc: Courtroom D, Fourth Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony C. Clayton

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on February 23, 2023 at 09:15 am.

11:15 AM Defendant Anthony C. Clayton in court. Prosecuting  Attorney David Zarwell in court for State of Wisconsin. Court finds the defendant indigent. Court appoints Attorney Kelly Freeman. Defendant to pay $150/month. Scheduling order to be sent out to parties.
Calendar call scheduled for February 23, 2023 at 09:15 am.
Indigency hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:45 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: 4:31 PM Defendant Anthony C. Clayton in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared by video. Defendant enters not guilty plea. Bond will continue.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

4:29 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony C. Clayton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colin T Nicholson appeared by video for Anthony C. Clayton. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Signature bond set of $1,000.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.L.A., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. No Acts or threats of violence. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 1PM.
